page.title: 03Village School
page.content:
Education in Marden goes back nearly 400 years. Jane Shelley, whose husband lost his life for taking part in a plot against Queen Elizabeth 1st. left provision for a school for the boys of Marden and Sutton. It was founded in 1609.
The present school was opened in 1874. The School Board paid Â£112 for the land and Â£1,478 for the building. At present there is a scheme for remodelling or rebuilding the school and we are sure that the local Education Authority would like a return to the costings of 111 years ago.
